work.name: Orange County Lettings Project
highlights:
OpenClassrooms project >> Redesigning a modular architecture >>
 Using Docker >> Additionning a CI/CD pipeline using CircleCI and Heroku to deploy
work.summary: Scale a Django application using a modular architecture Reduction of various technical debts on the project

work.name: Veeam Software
work.summary: Veeam Software, a socity which the global leader in data protection asked me to develop a small program that synchronizes two folders: source and replica. The program should maintain a full, identical copy of source folder at replica folder

work.name: SoftDesk API Project
highlights: OpenClassrooms project >> Working on an API with Django REST Framework >> Using Inomnia to test the EndPoints.Creating a documenter Insomnia
work.summary: Create a secure RESTful API using Django-Rest Framework

work.name: LITReview Project
work.summary: Create a web application using Django to allow reviews or posts of book’s articles : . Backend based on Python and using Django Framework. Frontend based on Css, Html, js, . Db based on Sqlite3

work.name: Soflix Project
highlights: OpenClassrooms project >> Using JavaScript >> Html >> CSS
work.summary: Develop a user interface for python website application like Netflix. Develop the frontend of an application with HTML and CSS. Interact with an API with Java Script

work.name: AlgoInvest-Trade
highlights: OpenClassrooms project >> Python >> Working on a BruteForce algorithme
work.summary: AlgoInvest & Trade is an investment society who would like to develop an algorithme to optimize the way to get more money in the best way.

work.name: Chessmat
highlights: OpenClassrooms project >> Python >> SQL >> Working on a MVC pattern
work.summary: Edouard, in charge of a Chess Club wish to get an application to manage Tournaments Chess Event off line and produce reports in the link with Tournaments

work.name: Webscraping
highlights: OpenClassrooms project >> Python >> Data >> Woking on a ETL
work.summary: My team leader has asked me to develop a beta version of a program to track book prices at Books to Scrape, an online book retailer. It will be an on-demand application to retrieve prices at runtime

education.area: Application Backend, Application Frontend, API, CI/CD, Testing

references.name: Kevin , Formind
references.reference: I had the chance to collaborate with Emile on application development missions using the Django framework. His curiosity and his involvement allowed me to discover a professional personality, doing his best to meet the customer's needs. He likes what he does and is fully involved in the proposed problems. Despite his junior position, he has strong predisposition to be a very good developer with a good sense of customer relations and meeting deadlines. He also knows how to develop in an agile way and adapt his code daily

references.name: Stéphane Marin
references.reference: I have worked with Emile at two different companies and have known him from 2 years. Emile is the finest programmer I have ever had the pleasure to work with. He is a true self-starter and I have never known him to shy away from learning something new, often becoming an expert on the subject in a very short time. I will always attempt to hire him whenever I'm in the position to do so.
